title: Error with LeagueClient.exe?
body:
Yesterday at the same hour of today I was playing the game without no problem (just some lagg from the server the usual I get from time to time), now today I tried to play and I get this message:

C:/Riot Games/League of Legends/libcrypto-1_1.dll is either not designed to run on Windows or it contains an error. Try instaling the program again using the original installation media or contact your system administrator or the software vendor for support. Error status 0xc0000020.

And it wont allow me to open the game at all. It just pop up at the moment I click on the LoL icon that I always click to open the game and play.

Any suggestions? Do I have to uninstall and reinstall it all over again? -.-

replies.body: I started getting it last week and tried uninstalling and reinstalling but the messages came up again

This error can happen if security settings are blocking files from being accessed or installed properly.  I'd suggest starting off with the steps in our [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to make sure access to League is being allowed.

Once complete, download our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) and perform a reinstall to make sure everything is in order.

I have just followed all of the steps you have mentioned but it seems to be giving me to same error. I'm going to try a reinstall for the third time through the hextech tool to see if that works.

If you have any other suggestions that would be greatly appreciated. Thanks!

Hey, let our tech team help you out directly through a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  Grab the logs from the HRT and attach it to your ticket, we'll see you there!

If u want it to work go into ur riot games file and go into the lol file next open the RADS file and into projects and then open the League_client file and press on releases and go into the release with the highest number and when u do that search the file for libcrypto-1_1 copy and then go back to the C:\Riot Games\League of Legends file and paste it there and then press replace file in destination and it should work

I am having the same problem. The cause of the problem was that I dodged a game because there was a ahri jgl.
I looked at the permission guide but everything seems fine.
Then when I try to reinstall it with the hextech repair tool but everytime it says that it failed to reinstall it. 
I already tried a regular reinstall 3 times.
It could also be that I did the permission guide steps wrong.  Because I am a dutch person so my laptop is also dutch so I do sometimes have trouble with finding some things on my laptop.

It sounds like there might still be something blocking it, unless you've run out of space on your hard drive.  Grab the logs from the HRT and hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new), and our tech team will work with you individually to figure this out.

I made a thread that shows you how to fix it, but it seems like new files break upon patching and I seem to get the files just fine they just break and lose data when they are downloaded. I will try to look into my firewall and other security systems, but the permissions aren't a problem the problem seems that the files are losing data as they are coming in causing it to not be able to run. I haven't quite figured it out yet, but what I do seems to be a really simple fix for now.
Yeah I got this too, is this a known issue or is this something they can fix?
